sentence.idiomatic: She went and bought a professional suit just for the interview.
Hearing I had fallen sick, he rushed back from out of town particularly to take care of me. It really touched me.
Why are you choosing this particular time to hold the meeting?
Everyone is on the same team. If you've got something to say, say it. Don't create a ruckus over something trivial.
He is not helping me, and instead went to help others. He didn't treat me like part of the team at all.
We're family but you still act this polite? The gifts I give you, you should just accept.
There are too many of these types of films. I'm sick of watching them.
Don't you get sick of eating the same food every day?
I got sick of computer games a long time ago, how is it that you just started playing? That's really passe.
You're the expert when it comes to design, it's a good idea to do things your way.
I didn't realize you were so professional at photography. These photographs are really professional.
It's ridiculous. How could the company let an amateur like you lead the experts?
After doing a comparison, we discovered that this store's prices are reasonable.
The reason everyone supports him is that he manages things fairly, and he never unfairly sides with his own people.
To speak fairly, he is your older brother. No matter what he did wrong, you shouldn't beat him.
This is my turf. I do whatever I want.
You don't need to worry when you're on your posse's turf, no one will dare to pick on you.
A serious shooting happened here last night. The police suspect the mob are having a turf war.
I finished this book in a day, I thoroughly enjoyed it.
She bought a dozen-or-so clothes yesterday, and still said she wasn't going over the top. Speaking plainly, she's a shopaholic.
In this game both sides played extremely intensely--everyone watched with great excitement.
Do you have the goods?
What are you talking about?
Nothing. I've been sent by Big Head. I know that you've got everything, so I came over just to see.
Oh, you're one of us. What do you want? My marijuana and ecstacy are both good.
Those things aren't fun anymore. Give me something with a little punch.
Want K or Ice? They've been selling like hotcakes lately.
OK. Let me see the goods.
You're quite the expert. Come buy often, and look for me. I've got a lot of new stuff, and the price is decent.
Oh. It's not bad. How do you sell cocaine?
It's hard to bring cocaine into the country, what about heroin? A lot of people are into herion now.
All right. Big Head says that your business hasn't been bad lately, and that all the nearby discos are your turf.
It's OK. When people go out these days, they always want to get a little something to take so they can enjoy themselves to the full. Where there's demand, there's a market.
Aren't you afraid of being caught by the cops?
It's a market economy, what does it have to do with them?
Oh yeah? Today I'll show you how we deal with people like you.

word.literal: to enjoy oneself to the fullest
